N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 2.36 - Hand-washing facilities-item 8p

State Regulations
(a) Hand-washing facilities shall be provided
that are conveniently located and are designed to ensure that an employee's
hands are not a source of contamination of food, food-contact surfaces, or
food-packaging materials. Adequate hot and cold and/or warm running water, and
soap and individual sanitary towels or other approved hand-drying devices, shall be provided. (b) Hand-washing
facilities are convenient to all toilets and to all rooms in which milk plant
operations are conducted. (c) Hand-washing facilities are kept in a clean condition and in good
repair. (d) Steam-water mixing
valves and vats for washing bottles, cans and similar equipment are not used as
hand-washing facilities. Notes
